vision.title: Our vision
vision.subtitle: A manifesto game to fight bullying
vision.point1Desc: Pixel-Chef, a hero who enters "into the brain" of the school to repair the dark pixels representing sad students.
vision.point2Desc: Abstract and dynamic levels where glitches (monsters from bullying) invade the hallways.
vision.point3Desc: Light, color and joy by "awakening" the freed students.
vision.point4Desc: Players to recognize and fight bullying IRL.
vision.objective: Goal: make Pixel Hero School an accessible manifesto game (E10+) that combines fun, reflection and social impact.
vision.pedagogyDescription: The project's goal was to introduce students and teachers to new working methods, focused on agile methodology, tech project management and the adoption of active pedagogies. Through the creation of a collective project around the theme of school bullying, participants explored audiovisual and digital professions, while developing collaborative and creative skills inspired by the professional world.

features.universeDescription: Pixel Hero School takes place within the digital infrastructure of a fictional French school. Each zone — "Rumor Corridors", "Forgotten Library", "Pressure Gym" — personifies a facet of school life. Your mission: purify these zones and remind each student that they are not alone.
